repnme.cdata!:
Cote d'Ivoire - Economic Management
            Technical Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project is rated as marginally
            unsatisfactory in its outcome, and unlikly to be sustained.
            Overall Bank performance is rated as satisfactory, despite
            the drop in supervision intensity during the latter years of
            project execution, when the focus was on attempts to use
            unspent balances of project resources. On the whole,
            Borrower performance was satisfactory. Six lessons were
            learned from this project: On a strategic level, a project
            seeking to invest in techncial capacity needs to ensure that
            government staff skills, education, management systems and
            equipment are underpinned by institutional arrangements
            capable of creating incentives and rules to effectively
            harness the fruits of such investments. Second the
            traditional multi-component technical assistance projects
            with multiple executing agencies addressing a core
            government function should include only those components
            that are closely interdependent. Third an unmanageable
            component of a third should be dropped and freed up
            resources shifted to components that are implementing well.
            Fourth the implications of the technical complexity of
            computerized information systems should not be
            underestimated. Fifth excessive staff turnover compromised
            the continuity and purposefulness of project execution.
            Sixth, proper planning and arrangements should be made to
            ensure that counterparts are made available to work
            alongside external consultants, and that they are given
            incentives to stay committed for the duration of the projec

18155680.theme: Law reform,Administrative and civil service reform,Macroeconomic management,Economic statistics, modeling and forecasting
18155680.trustfund:
UN007140-ASSES.OF THE SOCIAL COSTS OF STRUCT.ADJ.,TF023141-CANADA-SDA IN SSA II,TF020940-NORWAY-SDA ASESMNT OF SOCIAL DIMENSIONS,TF025930-PHRD-PRIVATIZATION FOR THE
            TOURISM INDUSTRY PROJECT (BANK-EXECUTED),TF027530-ECONOMIC MANAGEMENT
18155680.majtheme: Economic management,Rule of law,Public sector governance

abstracts.cdata!:
The key objectives of the project are to
            assist the government in creating the institutional capacity
            necessary for implementing economic policy measures. To this
            end, it aims towards establishing a more efficient and
            leaner administration, capable of setting the stage for a
            restoration of Cote d'Ivoire's competitiveness,
            growth and creditworthiness. The project will provide a
            complement of computers, software and critical office
            equipment as well as a limited number of vehicles to help:
            (a) strengthen the capacity of the Ministry of Economy,
            Finance, and Plan (MEFP) to: (i) better manage the planning,
            programming and budgeting cycle; (ii) provide timely
            national accounts and produce reliable basic social,
            economic and demographic data; (iii) follow up parapublic
            enterprises' finances; and (iv) upgrade skills of key
            staff in MEFP directories participating in the project; (b)
            support the Ministry of Employment and Civil Service to
            better manage the civil service and the wage bill and set
            the stage for a comprehensive civil service reform; and (c)
            support the government's effort to create a legal and
            judiciary environment more conducive to overall economic
            development and providing adequate protection to business activities.
